page.title: 06The Interior of the Church.
page.content: Some of the most interesting items in St. Peter's Church are the eight misericords or the monks' stalls. Beneath them, on the underside, can be seen the reason for their popularity with the older monks. They are the original stalls dating from the 14th century. There is a squint on the left hand wall in the Pyel Chapel, this was so that lepers and other unwelcome worshippers could obtain an excellent view of the altar through the squint during church services. Restoration has been in progress in the church for several years. The crumbling stonework has been replaced and the rest cleaned, the roof has been completely replaced, using much of the old lead and the main beam above the altar had to be renewed.
